Class Hand

  • java.lang.Object
    • CardList
      • Hand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Flush, FullHouse, Pair, Quad, Single, Straight, StraightFlush, Triple

    public abstract class Hand
extends CardList
    Abstract super class that is used for representing a combination of cards. Contains player of this hand as a variable. Contains methods for getting player of this hand, getting top card of this hand, checking whether this hand beats a certain hand. Contains abstract methods to be overridden for checking if the hand is valid and getting the type of the hand.
    Author:
    choijaewon
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hand

        public Hand(CardGamePlayer player,
            CardList cards)
        Constructor setting player of this hand and list of cards representing hand.
        Parameters:
        player - player of this hand.
        cards - list of cards to compose this hand.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Methods to be overridden in every subclass of this class. Used to getting value of each hand consisted of 5 cards. Hand that beats a certain hand gets the higher value. Straight - 0, Flush - 1, FullHouse - 2, Quad - 3, StraightFlush -4.
        Returns:
        0 return meaningless value since it is going to be overridden.

      • getPlayer

        public CardGamePlayer getPlayer()
        Retrieves player of this hand.
        Returns:
        player player of this hand.

      • getTopCard

        public Card getTopCard()
        Retrieves the card that has highest value in hand according to the BigTwo card game.
        Returns:
        card card that has the highest value in hand.

      • beats

        public boolean beats(Hand hand)
        Checks if hand beats a certain hand.
        Parameters:
        hand - hand that is to be compared with the hand using this method.
        Returns:
        true when this hand wins. false when this hand loses.

      • isValid

        public abstract boolean isValid()
        Abstract method to be overridden in subclasses. Checks if this hand is valid or not.
        Returns:
        true when hand is valid. false when hand in invalid.

      • getType

        public abstract java.lang.String getType()
        Abstract method to be overridden in subclasses. Retrieves the name of hand in string type.
        Returns:
        type of the hand which corresponds to the name of the hand in game.
